content.question: Blocks <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> are placed in thermal contact with each other, as shown, and isolated from the surroundings. Initially, the temperatures of blocks <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> are <math alttext="T sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="T sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="T sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>, respectively, where <math alttext="T sub A is greater than T sub B, which is greater than T sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>. After a long time, the blocks reach thermal equilibrium at temperature <math alttext="t sub equilibrium" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></math>. Which of the following comparisons is correct?

choices.label: <math alttext="T sub equilibrium, equals T sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="T sub equilibrium is greater than T sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="T sub equilibrium is less than T sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="T sub A is greater than T sub equilibrium, which is greater than T sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="T sub A is greater than T sub equilibrium, which is greater than T sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
